definition: derailment/to jump the track (of train)/to derail
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Mothers frequently have runs in their stockings.
sentences.chinese: 母親的長筒襪經常脫線。

sentences.english: And the lining of my husband's jacket has come unstitched.
sentences.chinese: 我丈夫的茄克衫襯裏脫線了。

sentences.english: The buttons on my coat came unfastened.
Loose threads and other poor quality construction inside?
sentences.chinese: 脫線等質量低劣建築裏面？

sentences.english: The coat I just bought has come unstitched.
sentences.chinese: 我剛買來的衣服脫線了。

definition: to be unable to withstand a single blow/to collapse at the first blow
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
dichlorvos C4H7Cl2PO4, organic phosphate used as insecticide (loanword)/also called dimethyl dichloro-vinyl phosphate DDVP
